title: Rate in/rate out: total water- graph and equation

content.description: At time t = 0 minutes, a tank contains 100 liters of water. The piecewise-linear graph above shows the rate R(t), in liters per minute, at which water is pumped into the tank during a 55-minute period.
content.question: At time t = 10 minutes, water begins draining from the tank at a rate modeled by the function D, where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>/</mo><mn>10</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44D0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> liters per minute. Water continues to drain at this rate until time t = 55 minutes. How many liters of water are in the tank at time t = 55 minutes?

frqParts.text: At time t = 10 minutes, water begins draining from the tank at a rate modeled by the function D, where <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>D</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><msup> <mi>e</mi> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi><mi>t</mi> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>/</mo><mn>10</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44D0@</annotation> </semantics> </math> liters per minute. Water continues to drain at this rate until time t = 55 minutes. How many liters of water are in the tank at time t = 55 minutes?

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
